Function.Description: The replace function replaces a specified number of characters in a Text or String with another Text or String.

Brief.Overview: The replace function replaces a specified number of characters in a Text or String with another Text or String. The replace function is non-destructive
Brief.Usage: The replace function replaces only the substring at the specified index. The replace function is similar to the substitute function, except that substitute can replace any or all of the occurrences of the specified substring whereas replace only replaces one at a specified position in the String.

Argument.Name: old-text
Argument.Note: A String object or Text that contains the text to be replaced.

Argument.Name: start
Argument.Note: A positive integer indicating the position of the first character in old-text to be replaced. Set start to 0 for the first character, 1 for the second and so on

Argument.Name: length
Argument.Note: A positive integer representing the number of characters, after the starting position, to be replaced.

Argument.Name: new-text
Argument.Note: The Text or String to be inserted in old-text at start, replacing the specified characters. new-text does not have to be the same length as length

Syntax.Return: The result string after the replace has been done
